thread.title: 10 Awesome Pieces Of Classical Music For Metalheads [News]
thread.title_full: 10 Awesome Pieces Of Classical Music For Metalheads [News]

title: 10 Awesome Pieces Of Classical Music For Metalheads [News]
text:
10 Awesome Pieces of Classical Music for Metalheads Got something to add? UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted 12 hours ago 14 
An interesting video list has surfaced via Loudwire, showcasing a set of 10 classical pieces suited for metal fans. 
The source noted: "If you've been craving to get into some of the heaviest and most epic pieces of music ever written, your taste may expand beyond metal without you even knowing it! 
"Whether it be from the true classical era, baroque, romantic or modernist era of old school tunes, evil and violent themes mixed with world class musicianship is a centuries-old concept." 
You can check out the list of featured compositions and the video right below. Classical compositions for metal fans 
Shostakovich - "Symphony No. 11" Wagner - "Ride of the Valkyries" Prokofiev - "Scythian Suite, Op. 20" Chopin - "Concerto No. 2" Holst - "Mars, Bringer of War" Beethoven - "Symphony No. 5" Bach - "Toccata & Fugue in D Minor" Rachmaninoff - "Prelude in C-Sharp Minor, Op. 3, No. 2" Liszt - "Inferno"
